__e: Well, this might not be nice to say but if anyone deserves cancer, it's your mother.
The worst part about cancer isn't what it does to you... but what it does to the people you love.
Yeah, no, I get what you're saying but cancer is cancer, so...
She died of a cancerous growth on the brain stem.
You have brain cancer, and you're worried about me? Will you stop saying "brain cancer"
They tell you got brain cancer.
I know there's a history of cancer in the family.
So he says, "Give me the one with cancer instead".
There isn't any cancer in my family, but there is in yours.
Well, she's dying of cancer. She's had two attempts made at her life. Other than that, she's doing all right.
You know dad has had cancer, and all that, right?
If it's cancer, and I find out you knew, I won't be dying alone.
Does this word "cancer" pop into your mind a lot a little bit, what?
Did you just get diagnosed with cancer, or something, David? You see?
Cancer, to tell you the truth.
